news.title: After Italy, WhatsApp excludes Brazil from rival chatbot ban
news.summary: WhatsApp is allowing AI providers to continue offering their chatbots to users in Brazil, days after the country's competition agency ordered the company to suspend its new policy that bars third-party, general-purpose chatbots from the app.

news.title: Indian SpaceX rival EtherealX hits 5x valuation as it readies engine tests
news.summary: EtherealX is ramping engine tests and building a 150-acre rocket campus in India as it targets a 2027 launch mission.

news.title: Microsoft taps India’s Varaha for durable carbon removal offtake
news.summary: Microsoft is buying over 100,000 tons of carbon dioxide removal credits from India's Varaha over the next three years.

news.title: Mira Murati’s startup, Thinking Machines Lab, is losing two of its co-founders to OpenAI
news.summary: The abrupt change in personnel was in the works for several weeks, according to an OpenAI executive.

news.title: The FTC’s data-sharing order against GM is finally settled
news.summary: The order, first proposed a year ago, bans GM from collecting and then selling geolocation data to third parties, like data brokers and insurance companies.

news.title: OpenAI’s ChatGPT translator challenges Google Translate
news.summary: OpenAI has launched ChatGPT Translate, a standalone web translation tool that supports over 50 languages and is positioned as a direct competitor to Google Translate. news.title: Wikipedia turns 25 and shares a glimpse into the lives of its volunteer editors
news.summary: It's been 25 years since the launch of Wikipedia on January 15th, 2001, and it's come a long way from housing just 100 pages to becoming a behemoth of online knowledge with more than 65 million articles that get almost 15 billion views each month. news.title: Microsoft, Meta, and Amazon are paying up for ‘enterprise’ access to Wikipedia
news.summary: Microsoft, Meta, Amazon, Perplexity, and Mistral AI have joined Google in paying the Wikimedia Foundation for access to its projects, including Wikipedia's vast collection of articles. news.summary: Any ebook reader will let you cram a Beauty and the Beast-sized library’s worth of books in your pocket, but so will your phone. news.title: Exclusive: Volvo tells us why having Gemini in your next car is a good thing
news.summary: In-car personal assistants are about to get useful, it looks like.

news.title: A British redcoat’s lost memoir resurfaces
news.summary: Shadrack Byfield lost his left arm in the War of 1812; his life sheds light on post-war re-integration.

news.title: Musk and Hegseth vow to “make Star Trek real” but miss the show’s lessons
news.summary: AI weapons systems may annihilate their creators.

news.title: SC measles outbreak has gone berserk: 124 cases since Friday, 409 quarantined
news.summary: On Jan. 6, there were 211 cases. The outbreak, which began in October, is now at 434.

news.title: A single click mounted a covert, multistage attack against Copilot
news.summary: Exploit exfiltrating data from chat histories worked even after users closed chat windows.

news.title: Livestream: Welcome to the Chinese Century
news.summary: Join our livestream — and pose a question to WIRED’s panel of experts — on China’s dominance, influence, and how it is rewriting the future.

news.title: Hundreds of Millions of Audio Devices Need a Patch to Prevent Wireless Hacking and Tracking
news.summary: Flaws in how 17 models of headphones and speakers use Google’s one-tap Fast Pair Bluetooth protocol have left devices open to eavesdroppers and stalkers.

news.title: The Tea App Is Back With a New Website
news.summary: Months after major data leaks, the app where women leave Yelp-style reviews about men is relaunching with a new website. It’s not back on iOS, but the Android app has new AI features.

news.title: The Real AI Talent War Is for Plumbers and Electricians
news.summary: The AI boom is driving an unprecedented wave of data center construction, but there aren’t enough skilled tradespeople in the US to keep up.

news.title: Asus ROG Falcata Review: A Split Gaming Keyboard
news.summary: With the looks and speed of a gaming keyboard and the comfort of an ergonomic keyboard, the Falcata is a unique and expensive hybrid for a niche audience.
